sensors.widgets

Interface SensorWidget

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AlcoholThermometer

    public interface SensorWidget
    Super class for all Arduino graphical widgets. By implementing all of these methods, any subclass can be drawn properly, no matter what type of sensor is being represented.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void draw(int x, int y)
      Override this method to provide a graphical representation of you sensor
      boolean isDragging() 
      boolean isMouseOver() 
      int layer() 
      void setDragging(boolean isDragging) 
      void setLayer(int layer) 
      void setPos(int x, int y) 

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        void draw(int x,
        int y)
        Override this method to provide a graphical representation of you sensor
        Parameters:
        x - Distance from the left of the Processing canvas to draw widget
        y - Distance from the top of the Processing canvas to draw widget

      • isDragging

        boolean isDragging()
        Returns:
        A boolean value to indicate if the mouse button is in a "pressed" state.

      • isMouseOver

        boolean isMouseOver()
        Returns:
        A boolean value indicating if the mouse is over the widget. The isOver variable can be set with a simple test using the draw() coordinates: 
         if (applet.mouseX > x && applet.mouseX < x + widgetWidth && 
                 applet.mouseY > y && applet.mouseY < y  widgetHeight) {
    isOver = true;
}

      • layer

        int layer()
        Returns:
        The current layer of this widget.

      • setDragging

        void setDragging(boolean isDragging)
        Parameters:
        isDragging - Can simply indicate that the Processing "applet.mousePressed" has been detected.

      • setLayer

        void setLayer(int layer)
        Parameters:
        layer - Indicates the order in which the widgets are drawn. This allows us to select a widget, even if they are stacked on top of each other.

      • setPos

        void setPos(int x,
          int y)
        Parameters:
        x - Distance from the left of the Processing canvas to draw widget
        y - Distance from the top of the Processing canvas to draw widget
